executiveSummary: Trey and Don Brown, founders of Ride FRSH, pitched their subscription-based car air freshener company to the Sharks, seeking $200,000 for 5% equity. Despite initial skepticism and a humorous moment when Mark Cuban took offense to an NBA-related air freshener, Barbara Corcoran ultimately invested $200,000 for 20% contingent on key retail deals closing.
keyDecisions: Barbara Corcoran offered $200,000 for 20% equity contingent on Ride FRSH finalizing major retail partnerships, which the founders accepted.

actionItems.task: Finalize agreements with major automotive retailers for distribution (e.g., AutoZone deal worth $2.1M)
Collaborate with Barbara Corcoran to strategically expand retail and wholesale presence
Develop a female-oriented product line as suggested during feedback

nextSteps: The founders will proceed with securing their retail deals, working closely with Barbara Corcoran to scale the business into broader retail and wholesale channels while maintaining brand innovation.
